text:
Amélie Verdier (born 1977) is a French senior civil servant. Starting in January 2, 2017, she has been budget director in the Ministry of the Economy and Finance.
Life.
She was born on 1 July 1977 at Clichy, Hauts-de-Seine. She studied at Lycée Henri-IV, University of Paris 1 Pantheon-Sorbonne, and at Sciences Po.
She worked at the Inspection générale des finances. Between 2005 and 2009, she taught public finance at Sciences Po. From 2012 to 2014, she was chief of staff to Jérôme Cahuzac and then Bernard Cazeneuve. In June 2014, she was appointed secretary general of Assistance Publique – Hôpitaux de Paris. On 21 December 2016, she was appointed director of the budget by the Council of Ministers.
